page.title: 12LIFE ON A LOCAL FARM
page.content: Life on a farm is very different to living in a town or city.On our farm we have cows, chickens, pheasants, working dogs and race horses are bred. Crops,for example,potatoes, are grown. The farmers have to get up quite early around 5'O'clock. The machinery is usually washed down and the tractors in the fields by 6.The grooms feed the horses.I get up at 7 and help to feed the cows, chickens,pheasants and dogs.The farmers come home for breakfast at 8 and go out again at 8.30.They are in the fields all day except for coming in for dinner.The farmers day usually ends around 6.30. This happens nearly every day except for when there is a hunt or we go to the races.Mr.Snipe is the owner of the farm, manor and most of the land around Barnby.
